title: Identifying the quartiles.
text: First, you must look at where the first, second, and third quartiles are. The first is at $$0$$, the second at $$20$$, and the third slightly before $$100$$.

title: Understanding distance in box plots.
text: Secondly, you must understand that to be close in a box plot means that the data in those quarties is similar as there is not much variation. If they are far apart, there is more variation.
